record.title: CONSOLIDATED SECURITY, DISASTER ASSISTANCE, AND CONTINUING APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2009
record.narrative:
CONSOLIDATED SECURITY, DISASTER ASSISTANCE, AND CONTINUING APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2009 -- (Senate - September 26, 2008)

[Page: S9621]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Chair lay before the Senate a message from the House with respect to H.R. 2638, the Consolidated Security, Disaster Assistance, and Continuing Appropriations Act.

record.narrative: There being no objection, the Presiding Officer laid before the Senate the following message from the House of Representatives:

Resolved, That the House agree to the amendment of the Senate to the bill (H.R. 2638) entitled "An Act making appropriations for the Department of Homeland Security for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2008, and for other purposes." with an amendment to the Senate amendment.

speaking.paragraph: I move to concur in the amendment of the House to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2638 with an amendment at the desk.

record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
The Senator from Nevada [Mr. Reid] moves to concur in the House amendment to the Senate amendment with an amendment numbered 5660.

speaking.paragraph: I ask unanimous consent that reading of the amendment be dispensed with.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
At the end, add the following: The provisions of this Act shall become effective 2 days after enactment.

speaking.paragraph: I ask for the yeas and nays.

record.chair: There appears to be a sufficient second.
record.narrative: The yeas and nays were ordered.

speaking.paragraph: I have a second-degree amendment that I ask to be considered at this time.

record.chair: The Senator from Nevada [Mr. Reid] proposes an amendment numbered 5661 to amendment No. 5660.

speaking.paragraph: I ask unanimous consent that reading of the amendment be dispensed with.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
In the Amendment, strike "2" and insert "1".

speaking.paragraph: I now send a cloture motion to the desk on the motion to concur.

record.chair: The cloture motion having been presented under rule XXII, the clerk will report the motion to invoke cloture.
The assistant legislative clerk read as follows:

We, the undersigned Senators, in accordance with the provisions of rule XXII of the Standing Rules of the Senate, hereby move to bring to a close debate on the motion to concur in the House amendment with an amendment No. 5660 to H.R. 2638, the Department of Homeland Security Appropriations Act/Continuing Resolution for fiscal year 2009.

speaking.paragraph: I now ask that no motion to refer be in order during the pendency of the message.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
